title: OT symbol of knowledge in Middle East?
content:
Hi,

I’m about to design a training certificate for a company in Middle East region. I’d like to incorporate a symbol of knowledge as part of the artwork. But the problem is the meaning of symbols might be very different in different parts of the world.

For example a popular symbol of knowledge/wisdom in Poland (Europe) is an owl but who knows what it means in Kuwait?

[http://www.wpodkowie.osdw.pl/custom/\_3/img/logo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044243/http:/www.wpodkowie.osdw.pl/custom/_3/img/logo.png "http://www.wpodkowie.osdw.pl/custom/\_3/img/logo.png")

A kind of safe symbol might be a book but maybe there is something different and more specific for Middle East culture?

Oh, also any references to Middle East ornaments would be much appreciated.

AL

 [‹ Let it not be said](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044243/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33061 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type embellishments/ornaments designer ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044243/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33036 "Go to next forum topic")
author: aleksander
